A 2g relay antenna on a satellite on 600km orbite isn't enough to connect with a probe 5k in the atmosphere?

Edited December 21, 2020 by Mathrilord
Two immediate possibilities; the first would be reentry causes comm blackouts option is checked, the second may be that the satellite may be on the other side of the planet blocking a connection.

Assuming a "range modifier" of 1.0, the range between those two antennas should be 3 million meters. So yeah, if you don't have signal, the problem has to be something else.

 

Edited December 21, 2020 by bewing

Is the problem that the probe in the atmosphere can’t reach the relay satellite (could be plasma blackout if it’s going fast or just the satellite is beyond line of sight), or that the relay sat can’t reach back to a ground station on Kerbin (blocked by whatever body it’s orbiting or lacks the range), or that you’re not using a relay dish on the relay sat? Only relay dishes can bounce signals from other vessels, the ordinary direct ones do not so are only useful for direct communication back to Kerbin or to a nearby relay.
Do both satellites have an electrical charge in them?  If not, do you have solar panels so they can charge themselves when in the sun?
Plasma blackout... I forgot it's a stock option. Thanks
